Mesin Bermasalah, Daihatsu Recall Gran Max 1.5 dan Luxio
01 Nov 2019, 07:08 by Tempo.co, Wawan Priyanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - PT Astra Daihatsu Motor (ADM) menarik ulang (recall) 36.915 unit Daihatsu Gran Max dan Luxio tahun produksi Maret 2018 hingga April 2019. Dari angka itu, 32 ribu terdiri dari Gran Max dan 4.000 Luxio. Recall dilakukan karena masalah connecting rod yang berpotensi bermasalah sehingga menyebabkan mesin mati.
Sejauh ini, ADM menerima sebanyak enam kasus mesin mati pada Daihatsu Gran Max 1.5. Daihatsu Gran max 1.3 diklaim tidak mengalami masalah. “Kasusnya, enam unit Gran Max mengalami mesin mati dan menepi di jalan,” kata Anjar Rosjadi, Technical Services Division Head PT ADM di Sunter, Jakarta Utara, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Menurut Anjar, ciri-ciri Gran Max dan Luxio yang mengalami masalah pada connecting rod adalah mesin terdengar berisik pada saat berjalan di jalanan menanjak maupun datar. Mesin terdengar kasar sebelum mati dan berhenti. Pada saat jalanan menurun, gejalanya juga sama.
Anjar menjelaskan bahwa connecting rod ini merupakan bagian dari mesin yang menghubungkan piston dengan crank saft. Masalahnya adalah, connecting rod ini berpotensi patah yang menyebabkan mesin mati.
ADM akan bekerja sama dengan Astra World untuk menginformasikan recall melalui SMS dan telepon kepada konsumen. ADM juga akan memberikan edukasi kepada konsumen melalui media massa terkait recall yang dilakukan.
Poses penggantian conncting rod diperkirakan memakan waktu sekitar 14 jam. Saat ini ADM memiliki 156 jaringan bengkel tersebar di seluruh indonesia. “Terkait proses perbaikan ini, konsumen yang terdampak akan diberikan voucher paket penggantian oli gratis pada kunjungan servis berikutnya,” ujar Anjar.
Daihatsu Gran Max pertama kali diperkenalkan pada akhir 2007 dan mulai dipasarkan pada awal 2008. Hingga September 2019, total penjualan Gran Max 1.5 mencapai 300.337 unit.
text:
Troubled machines, Daihatsu Recall Gran Max 1.5 and Luxio
01 Nov 2019, 07:08 by Tempo.co, Wawan Priyanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - PT Astra Daihatsu Motor (ADM) recalled 36,915 units of Daihatsu Gran Max and Luxio from March 2018 to April 2019. From that figure, 32 thousand consisted of Gran Max and 4,000 Luxio. Recall was made because of a connecting rod problem that was potentially problematic, causing the engine to die.
So far, ADM has received as many as six cases of engine failure in Daihatsu Gran Max 1.5. Daihatsu Gran max 1.3 is claimed to have no problems. "The case is, six Gran Max units suffered a dead engine and pulled over on the road," said Anjar Rosjadi, PT ADM Technical Services Division Head in Sunter, North Jakarta, Friday, November 1, 2019.
According to Anjar, the characteristics of Gran Max and Luxio who have problems with the connecting rod are that the engine sounds noisy when walking on the road uphill or flat. The engine sounds rough before it stops and stops. When the road is down, the symptoms are the same.
Anjar explained that the connecting rod is part of the engine that connects the piston with the crank saft. The problem is, this connecting rod has the potential to break, causing the engine to die.
ADM will work with Astra World to inform consumers of recall via SMS and telephone. ADM will also provide education to consumers through mass media related to the recall made.
It is estimated that the replacement of the connecting rod will take about 14 hours. At present ADM has 156 workshop networks spread all over Indonesia. "Regarding this repair process, affected consumers will be given a free oil replacement package voucher on their next service visit," Anjar said.
Daihatsu Gran Max was first introduced in late 2007 and began to be marketed in early 2008. Until September 2019, total sales of Gran Max 1.5 reached 300,337 units.
